info.game_comments: Bernie Cullen game 2.  J! round only

(1, 1).clue: Handwritten lyrics on display include Chuck Berry's "School Days" & his "Purple Haze"

(2, 1).clue: In 1785 this future French emperor graduated from military school in Paris, 42nd in his class of 58

(3, 1).clue: Lumberjack shirts & kilts feature these designs

(4, 1).clue: He's the first person in the Bible to build a ship

(5, 1).clue: He was an employee of the Texas School Book Depository when he shot JFK from its 6th floor

(1, 2).clue: Jann Wenner, editor & publisher of this magazine, is 1 of 26 on the Hall's board of trustees

(2, 2).clue: Barons & churchmen drew up this 1215 document to reduce the power of England's King John

(3, 2).clue: What's considered the finest cotton in the world is grown in & named for this country

(4, 2).clue: God's first instructions to human beings were "be fruitful and" do this

(5, 2).clue: He established a commune for his "family" on the Spahn Ranch outside Los Angeles

(6, 2).clue: Type of turf for the Jetson's dog (5)

(1, 3).clue: Known for playing Ziggy Stardust, he donated a plaster cast of his face for the mannequins representing him

(2, 3).clue: In 1519 he & his men landed at Tabasco & began the Spanish conquest of Mexico

(3, 3).clue: Worn by South American Indians for centuries, it's square, has a hole in the middle & doubles as a blanket

(4, 3).clue: This strongman told the first riddle; it concerned a honey-filled lion

(5, 3).clue: Alvin "Creepy" Karpis holds the record for time served on this "rock" — 28 years

(1, 4).clue: He said, "In designing this building, it was my intention to echo the energy of rock and roll"

(2, 4).clue: In 1936 Italy conquered this Ethiopian capital & Haile Selassie fled to Great Britain

(3, 4).clue: Men's tails are also known by this longer, avian name

(4, 4).clue: Rachel is the first shepherdess mentioned & he's the first shepherd

(5, 4).clue: The St. Valentine's Day Massacre broke the power of this Chicago gangster nicknamed "Bugs"

(1, 5).clue: Equipment used by Sam Phillips to record Elvis Presley is on exhibit in a tribute to this record company

(2, 5).clue: In this mid-1930s this U.S. naval officer chartered the Edsel Ford mountains in Antarctica

(3, 5).clue: Famous for their seeksucker suits, these New York brothers made the frock coat Lincoln wore to Ford's Theatre

(4, 5).clue: This disguised man was the first person to kiss someone in the Bible; he kissed his father

(5, 5).clue: Ramon Mercader, who killed this Russian in Mexico in 1940, died in Havana in 1978
